intro: Thlaspi cilicicum, commonly known as the Cilician rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Eastern Mediterranean. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Thlaspi cilicicum is adapted to harsh climates and is considered a valuable species for ecological studies in arid and semi-arid regions.
